q: Donald Rumsfeld also defends the use of harsh interrogation tactics in his interview, saying that they`` saved lives.'' But he also admits that interrogators went past his orders with at least one detainee, Mohammed al-Qahtani : Qahtani would be subjected to sexual humiliation and long periods of sleep deprivation and isolation while in custody at Guantanamo, and his heartbeat at one point dropped to 35 beats per minute. Donald Rumsfeld said he only learned the details of such treatment after the fact- and that interrogators went further than he had authorized.`` I didn't approve any of that,'' Donald Rumsfeld said in

`` He has done nothing to deserve a key to the city of Dallas.'' On Monday, Dallas Mayor Tom Tom Leppert distanced himself from the presentation, href="http://www.dallasnews.com/sports/super-bowl/local/20110207-dallas-official-gives-Michael Vick-Michael Vick-key-to-the-city-draws-anger.ece" target="_blank"> telling the Dallas Morning News: We don't condone it and clearly didn't approve it. It's unfortunate, and I would rather have not seen the situation. Two council members told the newspaper that the presentation was inappropriate, though one defended it, saying Michael Vick `` served his time'' and`` did what the court told him to.'' The newspaper

veteran who had served as CEO of Novell and chief technology officer of Sun Microsystems, Eric Schmidt was brought in to provide some`` adult supervision.'' On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. `` I believe Larry Page is ready'' to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts.`` It's Tim Forde for him to have a shot at running this.''

Soul singer Solomon Burke , who wrote Everybody Needs Somebody To Love and recorded the hit`` Cry To Me'' used in the movie`` Dirty Dancing,'' has died at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport. He was 70. Dutch national broadcaster NOS said he died on a plane

details: Starting April 4, co-founder Larry Page , becomes CEO and takes over day-to-day operations. Co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, specifically, new products. Eric Schmidt becomes Executive Chairman and will focus externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership-all of which are increasingly important given Google's global reach. Internally, Eric Schmidt will continue to act as an advisor to Larry Page and Sergey Brin . On a call with analysts this afternoon, Eric Schmidt , Larry Page and Sergey Brin offered their thoughts on the movement for analysts. In their

who will do the most to determine the future of America's most-watched reality show. Simon Cowell and his smugness gone, the two men are trying to make`` Idol'' more true to its former motto, The Search for a Superstar.
